page.title: 12DONCASTER'S GYPSIES
page.content: Our town has long been favoured by travelling folk because of its function as a route centre and its racecourse. True gypsies call themselves "Roma" and Charles Bosville so called king of gypsies is said to be buried in a church yard in Rossington. The family we spoke to are living near Potteric Carr Junction. They have travelled up and down the town for 16 years. Employment for the men is as horse dealers and scrap merchants. The women make a living door to door trading. When a fair comes to town they tell fortunes and help on rides. The caravans are full of glass and white furniture. one custom is that nothing inside the caravan is taken outside. The children clean the caravan every day but their life style means that they do not attend school.
